horror.name: Dracula
horror.description: Bram Stoker's gothic masterpiece tells the chilling story of Count Dracula's attempt to move from Transylvania to England in order to spread the undead curse.

horror.name: Frankenstein
horror.description: Mary Shelley's iconic tale of Victor Frankenstein, a scientist who creates a living being from body parts, only to be horrified by the monster he brings to life.

horror.name: The Shining
horror.description: Stephen King's classic horror novel set in the isolated Overlook Hotel, where a family faces supernatural forces that drive the father, Jack Torrance, to madness.

horror.name: It
horror.description: In this Stephen King novel, a group of childhood friends returns to their hometown to confront an ancient evil, which takes the shape of a terrifying clown named Pennywise.

horror.name: The Haunting of Hill House
horror.description: Shirley Jackson’s classic horror novel that tells the story of a group of people who visit a haunted mansion, where disturbing events unravel the fragile minds of its inhabitants.

horror.name: The Exorcist
horror.description: William Peter Blatty's terrifying tale of a young girl who becomes possessed by a demon, and the battle between good and evil that ensues to save her.

horror.name: Pet Sematary
horror.description: Stephen King's chilling novel about a cemetery where animals buried there come back to life, leading to tragic and horrifying consequences for those who live near it.

horror.name: The Silence of the Lambs
horror.description: Thomas Harris' psychological horror-thriller that introduces the infamous Dr. Hannibal Lecter, a brilliant but murderous psychiatrist, and FBI agent Clarice Starling.

horror.name: American Psycho
horror.description: Bret Easton Ellis’ controversial novel about Patrick Bateman, a successful Wall Street executive with a dark, violent alter ego who commits horrific acts without remorse.

horror.name: World War Z
horror.description: Max Brooks' oral history of the global zombie apocalypse, told through a series of interviews with survivors, exploring the societal collapse and its aftermath.

horror.name: The Turn of the Screw
horror.description: Henry James’ psychological horror novel about a governess who is tasked with caring for two children at a remote estate, where she begins to see ghostly apparitions.

horror.name: The Babadook
horror.description: Based on the film, Jennifer Kent’s story about a mother and son haunted by a mysterious creature from a children’s book, which may be more than just a figment of their imagination.

horror.name: The Road
horror.description: Cormac McCarthy’s post-apocalyptic novel, where a father and son journey through a desolate and dangerous landscape, struggling to survive amidst the horrors of a dying world.

horror.name: Misery
horror.description: Stephen King's terrifying story of an author who is held captive by a deranged fan after a car accident, with brutal consequences as he struggles to escape.

horror.name: The Girl Next Door
horror.description: Jack Ketchum’s deeply disturbing novel based on true events, following the horrifying abuse of two sisters by their foster family in suburban America.

horror.name: House of Leaves
horror.description: Mark Z. Danielewski’s complex horror novel about a family who moves into a house with strange and terrifying characteristics, interwoven with layers of narrative and footnotes.

horror.name: The Woman in Black
horror.description: Susan Hill's gothic horror novel about a young lawyer who encounters the ghost of a mysterious woman while dealing with the affairs of a deceased client in a remote village.

horror.name: Bird Box
horror.description: Josh Malerman’s gripping post-apocalyptic horror novel where an unseen force drives people to madness and suicide, leaving survivors to navigate the world blindfolded to avoid the creatures.

horror.name: The Dark Tower: The Gunslinger
horror.description: Stephen King's epic horror fantasy about Roland, the last Gunslinger, who pursues the Man in Black across a vast desert in pursuit of the Dark Tower.

horror.name: The Ritual
horror.description: Adam Nevill’s terrifying story about a group of friends who take a shortcut through a Swedish forest, only to encounter an ancient evil lurking within.
